intro: Phytolacca malabarica, commonly known as the Indian pokeweed, is a herbaceous plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish flowers that develop into red, fleshy berries. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
